segments.text: Guess what ? I've got great news !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , you know how I've been working at the Economist as a proof-reader , right ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , the editor-in-chief heard that I had experience as an editor at another magadize and asked me if I was interested in becoming an assistant editor for him .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Really ? That's fantastic ! Will you get a chance to do any writing ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: She said that the columnist for the literary criticism column would be going on pregnancy leave soon and that I could be in charge of the column until she came back .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Wow ! That's really great news . How often does the magazine come out ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It's a monthly magazine , but my column will be shared with another columnist so my articles will be due fortnightly .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Are you looking forward to doing more editing work ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , but I'm even more excited about getting my thoughts published again !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Do you have any order forms here so that I can get a subscription to the magazine ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I don't have any with me , but I think I could manage to bring a free copy home for you .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'm really looking forward to reading your column .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Me , too . Do you want to go out to celebrate my good news ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Sure , where would you like to go ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Perhaps we could go to the library festival that's going on at the local bookshop .
segments.speaker: S1
